doc.dbt.__overview__.name: __overview__
doc.dbt.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the auto-generated documentation for your dbt project!

### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models
in your project.

#### Project Tab
The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the
models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab
The `Database` tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view
shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are _not_ shown
in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration
You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand`
button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build,
or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--select` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the
models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.

---

### More information

- [What is dbt](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/introduction)?
- Read the [dbt viewpoint](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/viewpoint)
- [Installation](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/installation)
- Join the [dbt Community](https://www.getdbt.com/community/) for questions and discussion

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_app_id_filter.name: macro_app_id_filter
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_app_id_filter.block_contents:
Generates a `sql` filter for the values in `app_ids` applied on the `app_id` column.

#### Returns

`app_id in (...)` if any `app_ids` are provided, otherwise `true`.

#### Usage

```sql
app_id_filter(['web', 'mobile', 'news'])

-- returns
app_id in ('web', 'mobile', 'news')
```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_columns_in_.name: macro_get_columns_in_relation_by_column_prefix
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_columns_in_.block_contents:
This macro returns an array of column objects within a relation that start with the given column prefix. This is useful when you have multiple versions of a column within a table and want to dynamically identify all versions.

#### Returns

An array of (column objects)[https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/dbt-classes#column]. The name of each column can be accessed with the name property.

#### Usage

```sql
get_columns_in_relation_by_column_prefix(ref('snowplow_web_base_events_this_run'), 'domain')

-- returns
['domain_sessionid', 'domain_userid', 'domain_sessionidx',...]

{% set matched_columns = snowplow_utils.get_columns_in_relation_by_column_prefix(
                    relation=ref('snowplow_web_base_events_this_run'),
                    column_prefix='custom_context_1_0_'
                    ) %}

{% for column in matched_columns %}
{{ column.name }}
{% endfor %}

# Renders to something like:
'custom_context_1_0_1'
'custom_context_1_0_2'
'custom_context_1_0_3'

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_schemas_by_.name: macro_get_schemas_by_pattern
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_schemas_by_.block_contents:
Given a pattern, finds and returns all schemas that match that pattern. Note that for databricks any single character matches (`_`) will not be properly translated due to databricks using a regex expression instead of a SQL `like` clause.

      #### Returns

      A list of schemas that match the pattern provided.

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_value_by_ta.name: macro_get_value_by_target_type
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_value_by_ta.block_contents:
Returns the value provided based on the `target.type`. This is useful when you need a different value based on which warehouse is being used e.g. cluster fields or partition keys.

#### Returns

The appropriate value for the target warehouse type, or an error if not an expected target type.

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_value_by_ta.name: macro_get_value_by_target
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_value_by_ta.block_contents:
This macro is designed to dynamically return values based on the target (`target.name`) you are running against. Your target names are defined in your [profiles.yml](https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/profiles.yml) file. This can be useful for dynamically changing variables within your project, depending on whether you are running in dev or prod.

#### Returns

The value relevant to the target environment

#### Usage

```yml

# dbt_project.yml
...
vars:
snowplow_web:
    snowplow__backfill_limit_days: "{{ snowplow_utils.get_value_by_target(dev_value=1, default_value=30, dev_target_name='dev') }}"

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_is_run_with_new.name: macro_is_run_with_new_events
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_is_run_with_new.block_contents:
This macro is designed for use with Snowplow data modelling packages like `snowplow-web`. It can be used in any incremental models, to effectively block the incremental model from being updated with old data which it has already consumed. This saves cost as well as preventing historical data from being overwritten with partially complete data (due to a batch back-fill for instance).

The macro utilizes the `snowplow_[platform]_incremental_manifest` table to determine whether the model from which the macro is called, i.e. `{{ this }}`, has already consumed the data in the given run. If it has, it returns `false`. If the data in the run contains new data, `true` is returned.

For the sessions lifecycle identifier it does not use the manifest as this table is not included in it.

#### Returns

`true` if the run contains new events previously not consumed by `this`, `false` otherwise.

#### Usage

```sql

{{
config(
    materialized='incremental',
    unique_key='screen_view_id',
    upsert_date_key='start_tstamp'
)
}}

select
...

from {{ ref('snowplow_mobile_base_events_this_run' ) }}
where {{ snowplow_utils.is_run_with_new_events('snowplow_mobile') }} --returns false if run doesn't contain new events.

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_log_message.name: macro_log_message
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_log_message.block_contents: A wrapper macro for the `dbt_utils.pretty_log_format` using the `snowplow__has_log_enabled` to determine if the log is also printed to the stdout.

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_post_ci_cleanup.name: macro_post_ci_cleanup
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_post_ci_cleanup.block_contents: This macro deletes all schemas that start with the specified `schema_pattern`, mostly for use before/after CI testing to ensure a clean start and removal of data after CI tests.

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_print_list.name: macro_print_list
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_print_list.block_contents:
Prints an array as a `seperator` separated quoted list.

#### Returns

Separated output of items in the list, quoted.

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_return_limits_f.name: macro_return_limits_from_model
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_return_limits_f.block_contents:
Calculates and returns the minimum (lower) and maximum (upper) values of specified columns within the specified table. Useful to find ranges of a column within a table.

#### Returns

A list of two objects, the lower and upper values from the columns in the model

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_set_query_tag.name: macro_set_query_tag
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_set_query_tag.block_contents:
This macro takes a provided statement as argument and generates the SQL command to set this statement as the query_tag for Snowflake databases, and does nothing otherwise. It can be used to safely set the query_tag regardless of database type.

#### Returns

An alter session command set to the `query_tag` to the `statement` for Snowflake, otherwise nothing

#### Usage

```sql

{{ snowplow_utils.set_query_tag('snowplow_query_tag') }}

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_n_timedeltas_ag.name: macro_n_timedeltas_ago
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_n_timedeltas_ag.block_contents:
This macro takes the current timestamp and subtracts `n` units, as defined by the `timedelta_attribute`, from it. This is achieved using the Python datetime module, rather than querying your database. By combining this with the `get_value_by_target` macro, you can dynamically set dates depending on your environment.

#### Returns

Current timestamp minus `n` units.

#### Usage

```sql

{{ snowplow_utils.n_timedeltas_ago(1, 'weeks') }}

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_string_agg.name: macro_get_string_agg
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_string_agg.block_contents:
This macro takes care of harmonising cross-db `list_agg`, `string_agg` type functions. These are aggregate functions (i.e. to be used with a `group by`) that take values from grouped rows and concatenates them into a single string. This macro supports ordering values by an arbitrary column and ensuring unique values (i.e. applying distinct).

Note that databricks does not have list/string_agg function so a more complex expression is used.

#### Returns

The data warehouse appropriate sql to perform a list/string_agg. 

#### Usage

```sql
select
...
{{ snowplow_utils.get_string_agg('base_column', 'column_prefix', ';', 'order_by_col', sort_numeric=true, order_by_column_prefix='order_by_column_prefix', is_distict=True, order_desc=True)  }},
...
from ...
group by ...

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_split_to_ar.name: macro_get_split_to_array
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_split_to_ar.block_contents:
This macro takes care of harmonising cross-db split to array type functions. The macro supports a custom delimiter if your string is not delimited by a comma with no space (default).

#### Returns

The data warehouse appropriate sql to perform a split to array. 

#### Usage

```sql
select
...
{{ snowplow_utils.get_split_to_array('my_string_column', 'a', ', ') }}
...
from ... a

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_array_to_st.name: macro_get_array_to_string
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_array_to_st.block_contents:
This macro takes care of harmonising cross-db array to string type functions. The macro supports a custom delimiter if you don't want to use a comma with no space (default).

#### Returns

The data warehouse appropriate sql to convert an array to a string. 

#### Usage

```sql
select
...
{{ snowplow_utils.get_array_to_string('my_array_column', 'a', ', ') }}
...
from ... a

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_sde_or_cont.name: macro_get_sde_or_context
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_sde_or_cont.block_contents:
This macro exists for Redshift and Postgres users to more easily select their self-describing event and context tables and apply de-duplication before joining onto their (already de-duplicated) events table. The `root_id` and `root_tstamp` columns are by default returned as `schema_name_id` and `schema_name_tstamp` respectively, where `schema_name` is the value in the `schema_name` column of the table. In the case where multiple entities may be sent in the context (e.g. products in a search results), you should set the `single_entity` argument to `false` and use an additional criteria in your join (see [the snowplow docs](https://docs.snowplow.io/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/dbt-advanced-usage/dbt-duplicates/) for further details).

Note that is the responsibility of the user to ensure they have no duplicate names when using this macro multiple times or when a schema column name matches on already in the events table. In this case the `prefix` argument should be used and aliasing applied to the output.

#### Returns

CTE sql for deduplicating records from the schema table, without the schema details columns. The final CTE is the name of the original table.

#### Usage

With at most one entity per context:
```sql
with {{ snowplow_utils.get_sde_or_context('atomic', 'nl_basjes_yauaa_context_1', "'2023-01-01'", "'2023-02-01'")}}

select
...
from my_events_table a
left join nl_basjes_yauaa_context_1 b on 
    a.event_id = b.yauaa_context__id 
    and a.collector_tstamp = b.yauaa_context__tstamp
```
With the possibility of multiple entities per context, your events table must already be de-duped but still have a field with the number of duplicates:
```sql
with {{ snowplow_utils.get_sde_or_context('atomic', 'nl_basjes_yauaa_context_1', "'2023-01-01'", "'2023-02-01'", single_entity = false)}}

select
...,
count(*) over (partition by a.event_id) as duplicate_count
from my_events_table a
left join nl_basjes_yauaa_context_1 b on 
    a.event_id = b.yauaa_context__id 
    and a.collector_tstamp = b.yauaa_context__tstamp
    and mod(b.yauaa_context__index, a.duplicate_count) = 0
```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_field.name: macro_get_field
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_get_field.block_contents:
This macro exists to make it easier to extract a field from our `unstruct_` and `contexts_` type columns for users in Snowflake, Databricks, and BigQuery (using a wildcard version number is only possible for BigQuery e.g. `column_name = 'contexts_nl_basjes_yauaa_context_1_*'`). The macro can handle type casting and selecting from arrays.

#### Returns

SQL snippet to select the field specified from the column

#### Usage

Extracting a single field
```sql

select
{{ snowplow_utils.get_field(column_name = 'contexts_nl_basjes_yauaa_context_1', 
                            field_name = 'agent_class', 
                            table_alias = 'a',
                            type = 'string',
                            array_index = 0)}} as yauaa_agent_class
from 
    my_events_table a

```

Extracting multiple fields
```sql

select
{% for field in [('field1', 'string'), ('field2', 'numeric'), ...] %}
  {{ snowplow_utils.get_field(column_name = 'contexts_nl_basjes_yauaa_context_1', 
                            field_name = field[0], 
                            table_alias = 'a',
                            type = field[1],
                            array_index = 0)}} as {{ field[0] }}
{% endfor %}

from 
    my_events_table a

```

doc.snowplow_utils.macro_parse_agg_dict.name: macro_parse_agg_dict
doc.snowplow_utils.macro_parse_agg_dict.block_contents:
This macro allows you to provide aggregations in a consistent and restricted way to avoid having to write the sql yourself. This is mostly for use within other packages to allow aggregations but not allow the user to add arbitrary SQL.

#### Returns

SQL snippet for the specified aggregation, aliased.

#### Usage

Extracting a single field
```sql

select
{{ snowplow_utils.parse_agg_dict({'type': 'countd', 'field': 'event_name', 'alias': 'distinct_event_types'})}}
from 
    my_events_table a

```

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_page_vie.name: table_page_view_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_page_vie.block_contents: This context table contains the `page_view_id` associated with an event.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_screen_c.name: table_screen_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_screen_c.block_contents: This context table contains the screen view ID associated with a mobile event.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_client_s.name: table_client_session_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_client_s.block_contents: This context table contains user and session identifiers associated with mobile events.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_pl.name: table_media_player_event
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_pl.block_contents: The table specifying the media player event type (e.g. playing, seek) and the label given for the media for user friendly identification.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_pl.name: table_media_player_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_pl.block_contents: This context table contains a set of entities that are common between media events across platforms.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_se.name: table_media_session_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_se.block_contents: This context table contains context entities for media player events that track sessions of media player usage (a media session is one video playback).

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.name: table_media_ad_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.block_contents: This context table contains context entities with information about the currently played ad.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.name: table_media_ad_break_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.block_contents: This context table contains context entities that are added to all ad events belonging to an ad break.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.name: table_media_ad_quartile_event
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.block_contents: This table contains self-describing event data fired when a quartile of ad is reached after continuous ad playback at normal speed.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_youtube_.name: table_youtube_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_youtube_.block_contents: The context table with data specific to embedded YouTube videos.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_html_med.name: table_html_media_element_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_html_med.block_contents: This context table contains the entities related to the HTML5 Media Element, adapted from the whatwg spec.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_html_vid.name: table_html_video_element_context
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_html_vid.block_contents: This context table contains the entities related to the HTML5 Video Element, adapted from the whatwg spec.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_events.name: table_events
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_events.block_contents: The `events` table contains all canonical events generated by [Snowplow's](https://snowplow.io/) trackers, including web, mobile and server side events.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event_id.name: col_event_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event_id.block_contents: A UUID for each event e.g. `c6ef3124-b53a-4b13-a233-0088f79dcbcb`.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_iden.name: col_media_identifier
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_iden.block_contents: The surrogate key generated from `player_id`, `media_label`, `media_type` and `media_player_type` to create a unique media element identifier.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_player_id.name: col_player_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_player_id.block_contents: The HTML id attribute of the media content. It is the `player_id` in case of YouTube and `html_id` in case of HTML5.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_id.name: col_play_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_id.block_contents: The surrogate key generated from `page_view_id`, `player_id`, `media_label`, `media_type` and `media_player_type` to create a unique play event identifier.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_page_view_.name: col_page_view_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_page_view_.block_contents:
A UUID for each page view e.g. `c6ef3124-b53a-4b13-a233-0088f79dcbcb`.
If more than one page view IDs were tracked for a single play ID, the first page view ID is used.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_page_view_.name: col_page_view_id_array
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_page_view_.block_contents:
All page_view_ids that were tracked for a play_id.
A play_id may contain more than one page_view_id in case the video was played in picture-in-picture mode across multiple app pages/screens.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_session_id.name: col_session_identifier
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_session_id.block_contents: The session identifier as defined in your project variables. Default to the media_session_id, or to page_view_id if the media session entity is not enabled.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_original_s.name: col_original_session_identifier
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_original_s.block_contents: The session identifier set by Snowplow using 1st party cookie. This is the domain_sessionid or session_id from the mobile session context.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_domain_ses.name: col_domain_sessionid_array
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_domain_ses.block_contents: All domain_sessionids seen for a play_id.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_user_ident.name: col_user_identifier
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_user_ident.block_contents: The user identifier as defined in your project variables. Default to domain_userid.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_domain_use.name: col_domain_userid
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_domain_use.block_contents: User ID set by Snowplow using 1st party cookie e.g. `bc2e92ec6c204a14`.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event_type.name: col_event_type
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event_type.block_contents: The type of event generated by the media player. e.g. 'ended', 'paused', 'playing'.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_type.name: col_media_type
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_type.block_contents: The type of media content: video or audio.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_play.name: col_media_player_type
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_play.block_contents: The combination of schema_name and schema_vendor coming from the specific media player context e.g. com.youtube-youtube, org.whatwg-media_element.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_source_url.name: col_source_url
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_source_url.block_contents: The url which shows the source of the media content. For YouTube it is the `url` context field, for HTML5 it is the `source_url` field.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_duration_s.name: col_duration_secs
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_duration_s.block_contents: Total length of media in seconds e.g. it's a 5:32 youtube video so the duration is 332 seconds.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_playback_q.name: col_playback_quality
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_playback_q.block_contents: Depending on the player it is either the playback quality field or the resolution.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_pr.name: col_percent_progress
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_pr.block_contents: The percent of the way through the media. It is based on either the percentprogress event that is fired at specific intervalls as defined during the tracker setup or the 'ended' event, which is equivalent to reaching 100% of the media's total duration (length). e.g. 25, meaning the user passed the 25% mark during play. It does not mean the user watched all the content in between two percentprogress marks, unless there is no seek events happening within the same page_view (`snowplow_media_player_base`).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_pr.name: col_percent_progress_reached
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_pr.block_contents: An array of percent progresses reached by the user while playing the media. In case the same percentprogress event was fired during the same page_view (e.g. due to seeks to rewatch part of the video) the % is added to the array again. e.g. in case of percent_progress_reached = [10, 25, 25, 50, 75] the user replayed part of the media so that the percentprogress event fired twice at the 25% mark.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_is_muted.name: col_is_muted
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_is_muted.block_contents: If the media is muted during the event that is fired.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_start_tsta.name: col_start_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_start_tsta.block_contents: The `derived_tstamp` denoting the time when the event started.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_end_tstamp.name: col_end_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_end_tstamp.block_contents: The `derived_tstamp` denoting the time when the last media player event belonging to the specific level of aggregation (e.g.: page_view by media) started.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_time_.name: col_play_time_secs
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_time_.block_contents:
Total seconds user spent playing content (excluding linear ads). If the media session entity is tracked with media events, the information is read from there. This is an accurate measurement provided by the tracker.

 This also counts playback of rewatched content (see `content_watched_secs` for a measurement without considering rewatched content).

If the media session entity is not tracked, the value is estimated. It is calculated using the percent_progress events that are fired during play. In case such an event is fired, it is assumed that the total section of the media in between the previous and current percent_progress is played through, even if the user seeks to another point in time within the audio / video. The more often these events are tracked (e.g. every 5% of the media's length) the more accurate the calculation becomes.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_paused_tim.name: col_paused_time_secs
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_paused_tim.block_contents:
Total seconds user spent with paused content (excluding linear ads).

This information is provided by the tracker in the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_buffering_.name: col_buffering_time_secs
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_buffering_.block_contents:
Total seconds that playback was buffering.

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ads_time_s.name: col_ads_time_secs
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ads_time_s.block_contents:
Total seconds that ads played.

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ads.name: col_ads
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ads.block_contents:
Number of ads played.

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ads_clicke.name: col_ads_clicked
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ads_clicke.block_contents:
Number of ads that the user clicked on.

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ads_skippe.name: col_ads_skipped
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ads_skippe.block_contents:
Number of ads that the user skipped.

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_breaks.name: col_ad_breaks
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_breaks.block_contents:
Number of ad breaks played.

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_content_wa.name: col_content_watched_secs
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_content_wa.block_contents:
Total seconds of the content played. Each part of the content played is counted once (i.e., counts rewinding or rewatching the same content only once).

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_content_wa.name: col_content_watched_percent
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_content_wa.block_contents:
Percentage of the content played.

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_play_t.name: col_avg_play_time_mins
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_play_t.block_contents:
Estimated average duration of plays in minutes. This also counts rewatched content (see `avg_content_watched_mins` for a measurement without considering rewatched content).

If the media session context entity is tracked with events, the information is taken from there which makes it more accurate since it is calculated on the tracker. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_conten.name: col_avg_content_watched_mins
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_conten.block_contents:
Average duration of the content played in minutes. Each part of the content played is counted once (i.e., counts rewinding or rewatching the same content only once).

Calculated on the tracker and provided through the media session context entity. If the media session entity is not tracked (when using our older tracking plugins or when it is disabled on the tracker), this property will be null.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_play_t.name: col_avg_play_time_sec
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_play_t.block_contents:
Estimated average duration of plays in seconds. This also counts rewatched content (see `content_watched_secs` for a measurement without considering rewatched content).

If the media session context entity is tracked with events, the information is taken from there which makes it more accurate since it is calculated on the tracker.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_first_play.name: col_first_play
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_first_play.block_contents: The `derived_tstamp` of the beginning of the first play of a media element.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_last_play.name: col_last_play
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_last_play.block_contents: The `derived_tstamp` of the beginning of the last play of a media element.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_valid_play.name: col_valid_plays
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_valid_play.block_contents: The sum of all media plays that exceeds the minimum media length set within the variable `snowplow__valid_play_sec`, it is defaulted to 30 (seconds).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_impression.name: col_impressions
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_impression.block_contents: The number of player instance (media sessions) where a media content was rendered regardless of whether the media was actually played or not.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_playba.name: col_avg_playback_rate
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_playba.block_contents: Average playback rate (1 is normal speed).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_rate.name: col_play_rate
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_rate.block_contents: Total plays divided by impressions. Please note that, if the media session ID is not available, as the base for media plays is pageview / media_identifier, in case the same video is played multiple times within the same pageview, it will still count as one play.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_complete_p.name: col_complete_plays
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_complete_p.block_contents: The number of plays where the total percentage played is bigger than or equal to the `snowplow__complete_play_rate`. Default is 0.99, meaning that 99% of the video being watched constitutes a complete play.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_completion.name: col_completion_rate_by_plays
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_completion.block_contents: The number of complete plays divided by the number of pageviews with plays of any duration.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_retention_.name: col_retention_rate
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_retention_.block_contents: The maximum percent progress reached before any seek event.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_percen.name: col_avg_percent_played
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_percen.block_contents: Average of total play_time divided by the media duration.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_x
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Field(s) calculated based on the `snowplow_mp_percent_progress` list, which shows how many times a certain percent progress has been reached. Please note that `100_percent_reached` = 1 does not necessarily mean that one user has played the media fully, but that there was either an 'ended' event or a 'percentprogress' event with a value of 100 and the user could still have seeked just before the end. If the same user replays part of the media during the same page_view, it will be counted in the total number.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_derived_ts.name: col_derived_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_derived_ts.block_contents: Timestamp making allowance for inaccurate device clock e.g. `2013-11-26 00:02:04`.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_collector_.name: col_collector_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_collector_.block_contents: Time stamp for the event recorded by the collector e.g. `2013-11-26 00:02:05`.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_weight_rat.name: col_weight_rate
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_weight_rat.block_contents: The weight given for each percent progress reached used for the calculation of the play_time_sec_estimated field. It is based on the difference of the current and preciding percent_progress rate.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_time_.name: col_play_time_muted_secs
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_time_.block_contents:
Total seconds user spent playing content on mute (excluding linear ads). If the media session entity is tracked with media events, the information is read from there. This is an accurate measurement provided by the tracker.

If the media session entity is not tracked, the value is estimated. It is based on the percent_progress event and whether the user played it on mute during this event or not.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_is_played.name: col_is_played
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_is_played.block_contents: Pageviews with at least one play event.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_is_valid_p.name: col_is_valid_play
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_is_valid_p.block_contents: A boolean value to show whether the duration of the play (`play_time_secs`) is bigger than or equal to the variable given in `snowplow__valid_play_sec` (defaulted to 30).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_is_complet.name: col_is_complete_play
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_is_complet.block_contents: A boolean value to show whether the total percentage played is bigger than or equal to the `snowplow__complete_play_rate` (defaulted to 0.99).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_seeks.name: col_seeks
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_seeks.block_contents: The count of seek events within a certain aggregation level. The seek event occurs when a user moves/skips to a new position in the media content.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_videos_pla.name: col_videos_played
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_videos_pla.block_contents: The distinct number of videos that were played during a session.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_audio_play.name: col_audio_played
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_audio_play.block_contents: The distinct number of audio files that were played during a session.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_valid_vide.name: col_valid_video_plays
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_valid_vide.block_contents: The sum of all video plays that exceed the limit set within the variable `snowplow__valid_play_sec`, it is defaulted to 30 seconds.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_valid_audi.name: col_valid_audio_plays
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_valid_audi.block_contents: The sum of all audio plays that exceeded the limit set within the variable `snowplow__valid_play_sec`, it is defaulted to 30 seconds.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_time_.name: col_play_time_mins
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_time_.block_contents: Calculated duration of play in minutes.  This also counts rewatched content (see `avg_content_watched_mins` for a measurement without considering rewatched content).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_time_.name: col_play_time_muted_mins
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_play_time_.block_contents: Calculated duration of muted play in minutes. It is based on the percent_progress event and whether the user played it on mute during this event or not.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_retent.name: col_avg_retention_rate
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_retent.block_contents: The average percent progress reached that is played before any seek event.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_plays.name: col_plays
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_plays.block_contents: The number of pageviews with plays of any duration.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_video_play.name: col_video_plays
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_video_play.block_contents: The number of pageviews with video plays of any duration.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_audio_play.name: col_audio_plays
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_audio_play.block_contents: The number of pageviews with audio plays of any duration.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_last_base_.name: col_last_base_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_last_base_.block_contents: The start_tstamp of the last processed page_view across all media_identifiers to be used as a lower limit for subsequent incremental runs.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_player_cur.name: col_player_current_time
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_player_cur.block_contents: The playback position of a specific media in seconds whenever a media player event is fired. Could be used in custom models for more detailed analytics or play time calculations.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_labe.name: col_media_label
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_labe.block_contents: The optional, human readable name given to tracked media content.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_sessio.name: col_avg_session_play_time_mins
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_sessio.block_contents: Estimated average duration of plays in seconds within a session.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_loop.name: col_loop
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_loop.block_contents: If the video should restart after ending.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_app_id.name: col_app_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_app_id.block_contents: Application ID e.g. ‘angry-birds’ is used to distinguish different applications that are being tracked by the same Snowplow stack, e.g. production versus dev.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_dvce_creat.name: col_dvce_created_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_dvce_creat.block_contents: Timestamp event was recorded on the client device e.g. ‘2013-11-26 00:03:57.885’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event.name: col_event
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event.block_contents: The type of event recorded e.g. ‘page_view’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_txn_id.name: col_txn_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_txn_id.block_contents: Transaction ID set client-side, used to de-dupe records e.g. 421828

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_user_id.name: col_user_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_user_id.block_contents: Unique ID set by business e.g. ‘jon.doe@email.com’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_user_finge.name: col_user_fingerprint
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_user_finge.block_contents: A user fingerprint generated by looking at the individual browser features e.g. 2161814971

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_network_us.name: col_network_userid
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_network_us.block_contents: User ID set by Snowplow using 3rd party cookie e.g. ‘ecdff4d0-9175-40ac-a8bb-325c49733607’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_geo_countr.name: col_geo_country
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_geo_countr.block_contents: ISO 3166-1 code for the country the visitor is located in e.g. ‘GB’, ‘US’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_geo_region.name: col_geo_region
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_geo_region.block_contents: ISO-3166-2 code for country region the visitor is in e.g. ‘I9’, ‘TX’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_geo_city.name: col_geo_city
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_geo_city.block_contents: City the visitor is in e.g. ‘New York’, ‘London’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_geo_zipcod.name: col_geo_zipcode
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_geo_zipcod.block_contents: Postcode the visitor is in e.g. ‘94109’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ip_organiz.name: col_ip_organization
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ip_organiz.block_contents: Organization associated with the visitor’s IP address – defaults to ISP name if none is found e.g. ‘Bouygues Telecom’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ip_domain.name: col_ip_domain
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ip_domain.block_contents: Second level domain name associated with the visitor’s IP address e.g. ‘nuvox.net’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_page_title.name: col_page_title
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_page_title.block_contents: Web page title e.g. ‘Snowplow Docs – Understanding the structure of Snowplow data’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_refr_sourc.name: col_refr_source
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_refr_sourc.block_contents: Name of referer if recognised e.g. ‘Bing images’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_refr_term.name: col_refr_term
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_refr_term.block_contents: Keywords if source is a search engine e.g. ‘psychic oracle cards’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_mkt_source.name: col_mkt_source
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_mkt_source.block_contents: The company / website where the traffic came from e.g. ‘Google’, ‘Facebook’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_mkt_term.name: col_mkt_term
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_mkt_term.block_contents: Any keywords associated with the referrer e.g. ‘new age tarot decks’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_mkt_conten.name: col_mkt_content
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_mkt_conten.block_contents: The content of the ad. (Or an ID so that it can be looked up.) e.g. 13894723

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_se_label.name: col_se_label
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_se_label.block_contents: The object of the action e.g. the ID of the video played or SKU of the product added-to-basket e.g. ‘pbz00123’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_se_propert.name: col_se_property
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_se_propert.block_contents: A property associated with the object of the action e.g. ‘HD’, ‘large’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_se_value.name: col_se_value
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_se_value.block_contents: A value associated with the event / action e.g. the value of goods added-to-basket e.g. 9.99

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_tr_affilia.name: col_tr_affiliation
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_tr_affilia.block_contents: Transaction affiliation (e.g. store where sale took place) e.g. ‘web’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_tr_tax.name: col_tr_tax
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_tr_tax.block_contents: Total tax included in transaction value e.g. 3.00

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ti_quantit.name: col_ti_quantity
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ti_quantit.block_contents: Number of product in transaction e.g. 2

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pp_xoffset.name: col_pp_xoffset_min
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pp_xoffset.block_contents: Minimum page x offset seen in the last ping period e.g. 0

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pp_xoffset.name: col_pp_xoffset_max
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pp_xoffset.block_contents: Maximum page x offset seen in the last ping period e.g. 100

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pp_yoffset.name: col_pp_yoffset_min
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pp_yoffset.block_contents: Minimum page y offset seen in the last ping period e.g. 0

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pp_yoffset.name: col_pp_yoffset_max
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pp_yoffset.block_contents: Maximum page y offset seen in the last ping period e.g. 200

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_lang.name: col_br_lang
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_lang.block_contents: Language the browser is set to e.g. ‘en-GB’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_pdf
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether the browser recognizes PDFs e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_flash
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether Flash is installed e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_java
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether Java is installed e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_director
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether Adobe Shockwave is installed e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_quicktime
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether QuickTime is installed e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_realplayer
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether RealPlayer is installed e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_windowsmedia
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether mplayer2 is installed e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_gears
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether Google Gears is installed e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.name: col_br_features_silverlight
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_feature.block_contents: Whether Microsoft Silverlight is installed e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_cookies.name: col_br_cookies
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_cookies.block_contents: Whether cookies are enabled e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_colorde.name: col_br_colordepth
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_br_colorde.block_contents: Bit depth of the browser color palette e.g. 24

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_dvce_ismob.name: col_dvce_ismobile
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_dvce_ismob.block_contents: Is the device mobile? e.g. True

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_doc_width.name: col_doc_width
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_doc_width.block_contents: The page’s width in pixels e.g. 1024

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_doc_height.name: col_doc_height
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_doc_height.block_contents: The page’s height in pixels e.g. 3000

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_tr_tax_bas.name: col_tr_tax_base
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_tr_tax_bas.block_contents: Total tax in base currency e.g. 3.00

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_tr_shippin.name: col_tr_shipping_base
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_tr_shippin.block_contents: decimal  Delivery cost in base currency e.g. 0.00

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ti_price_b.name: col_ti_price_base
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ti_price_b.block_contents: decimal Price in base currency e.g. 9.99

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_mkt_networ.name: col_mkt_network
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_mkt_networ.block_contents: The ad network to which the click ID belongs e.g. ‘DoubleClick’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_etl_tags.name: col_etl_tags
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_etl_tags.block_contents: JSON of tags for this ETL run e.g. “[‘prod’]”

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_dvce_sent_.name: col_dvce_sent_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_dvce_sent_.block_contents: When the event was sent by the client device e.g. ‘2013-11-26 00:03:58.032’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_refr_domai.name: col_refr_domain_userid
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_refr_domai.block_contents: The Snowplow domain_userid of the referring website e.g. ‘bc2e92ec6c204a14’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_refr_dvce_.name: col_refr_dvce_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_refr_dvce_.block_contents: The time of attaching the domain_userid to the inbound link e.g. ‘2013-11-26 00:02:05’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event_fing.name: col_event_fingerprint
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event_fing.block_contents: Hash client-set event fields e.g. AADCE520E20C2899F4CED228A79A3083

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_true_tstam.name: col_true_tstamp
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_true_tstam.block_contents: User-set “true timestamp” for the event e.g. ‘2013-11-26 00:02:04’

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event_in_s.name: col_event_in_session_index
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_event_in_s.block_contents: The index of the event in the corresponding session.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_ad_i.name: col_media_ad_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_ad_i.block_contents: Generated identifier that identifies an ad (identified using the ad_id) played with a specific media (identified using the media_identifier) and on a specific platform (based on the platform property).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_id.name: col_ad_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_id.block_contents: Unique identifier for the ad taken from the ad context entity.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_name.name: col_name
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_name.block_contents: Friendly name of the ad taken from the ad context entity.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_creative_i.name: col_creative_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_creative_i.block_contents: The ID of the ad creative taken from the ad context entity.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_duratio.name: col_ad_duration_secs
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_duratio.block_contents: Length of the video ad in seconds as reported in the ad context entity.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_skippable.name: col_skippable
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_skippable.block_contents: Indicating whether skip controls are made available to the end user (reported in the ad context entity).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_pod_po.name: col_avg_pod_position
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_avg_pod_po.block_contents: The average position of the ad within the ad break, starting with 1 (reported in the ad context entity).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_views.name: col_views
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_views.block_contents: Number of total views on the ad (repeated views are counted as well).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_clicks.name: col_clicks
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_clicks.block_contents: Number of total clicks on the ad (repeated clicks are counted as well).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_skips.name: col_skips
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_skips.block_contents: Number of total times users skipped the ad (repeated skips are counted as well).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_25
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Number of times users reached 25% of the ad playback (repeated views are counted as well).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_50
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Number of times users reached 50% of the ad playback (repeated views are counted as well).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_75
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Number of times users reached 75% of the ad playback (repeated views are counted as well).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_100
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Number of times users watched the whole ad (repeated views are counted as well).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_first_view.name: col_first_view
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_first_view.block_contents: Datetime of the first ad view.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_last_view.name: col_last_view
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_last_view.block_contents: Datetime of the last ad view.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_break_i.name: col_ad_break_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_break_i.block_contents: An identifier for the ad break (reported in the ad_break context entity).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_break_n.name: col_ad_break_name
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_break_n.block_contents: Ad break name (e.g., pre-roll, mid-roll, and post-roll), reported in the ad_break context entity.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_break_t.name: col_ad_break_type
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_break_t.block_contents: Type of ads within the break: linear (take full control of the video for a period of time), nonlinear (run concurrently to the video), companion (accompany the video but placed outside the player). Reported in the ad_break context entity.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pod_positi.name: col_pod_position
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_pod_positi.block_contents: The position of the ad within the ad break, starting with 1 (reported in the ad context entity).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_clicked.name: col_clicked
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_clicked.block_contents: Whether the ad was clicked during this ad view.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_skipped.name: col_skipped
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_skipped.block_contents: Whether the ad was skipped during this ad view.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_viewed_at.name: col_viewed_at
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_viewed_at.block_contents: Datetime when the ad was viewed.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_views_uniq.name: col_views_unique
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_views_uniq.block_contents: Number of users that viewed the ad (identified by their user_identifier).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_clicked_un.name: col_clicked_unique
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_clicked_un.block_contents: Number of users that clicked on the ad (identified by their user_identifier).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_skipped_un.name: col_skipped_unique
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_skipped_un.block_contents: Number of users that skipped the ad (identified by their user_identifier).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_25_unique
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Number of users that watched 25% of the ad (identified by their user_identifier).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_50_unique
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Number of users that watched 50% of the ad (identified by their user_identifier).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_75_unique
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Number of users that watched 75% of the ad (identified by their user_identifier).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.name: col_percent_reached_100_unique
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_percent_re.block_contents: Number of users that watched 100% of the ad (identified by their user_identifier).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: An identifier for the media session that is kept while the media content is played in the media player.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_time_played
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Total seconds user spent playing content (excluding linear ads).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_time_played_muted
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Total seconds user spent playing content on mute (excluding linear ads).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_time_paused
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Total seconds user spent with paused content (excluding linear ads).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_content_watched
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Total seconds of the content played. Each part of the content played is counted once (i.e., counts rewinding or rewatching the same content only once). Playback rate does not affect this value.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_time_buffering
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Total seconds that playback was buffering during the session.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_time_spent_ads
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Total seconds that ads played during the session.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_ads_clicked
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Number of ads that the user clicked on.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_ads_skipped
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Number of ads that the user skipped.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.name: col_media_session_avg_playback_rate
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_media_sess.block_contents: Average playback rate (1 is normal speed).

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_creativ.name: col_ad_creative_id
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_creativ.block_contents: The ID of the ad creative.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_pod_pos.name: col_ad_pod_position
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_pod_pos.block_contents: The position of the ad within the ad break, starting with 1.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_skippab.name: col_ad_skippable
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_skippab.block_contents: Indicating whether skip controls are made available to the end user.

doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_percent.name: col_ad_percent_progress
doc.snowplow_media_player.col_ad_percent.block_contents: The percent of the way through the ad.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_thi.name: table_base_this_run
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_thi.block_contents: This staging table aggregates media player interactions within the current run to a pageview level that is considered a base level for media plays.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base.name: table_base
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base.block_contents: This derived table aggregates media player interactions to a pageview level incrementally.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_plays_by.name: table_plays_by_pageview
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_plays_by.block_contents: This view removes impressions from the derived snowplow_media_player_base table for showing pageview level media play events. This means that only media player instances where a play event was tracked are kept (where `is_played` is true).

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_session_.name: table_session_stats
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_session_.block_contents: This table aggregates the base level plays to show session level media stats.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_user_sta.name: table_user_stats
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_user_sta.block_contents: This table aggregates the session level stats to show user level media stats.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_st.name: table_media_stats
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_st.block_contents: This derived table aggregates the pageview level interactions to show overall media stats.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_pivot_ba.name: table_pivot_base
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_pivot_ba.block_contents: This helper table serves as a base to calculate percent_progress based fields as well as the play_time metrics (by calculating the weight attributed to a percent progress being reached).

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.name: table_media_ad_views_this_run
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.block_contents: This derived table aggregates information about ad views. Each ad view (a user viewing a single ad within a media playback) is represented using one row. The ad views aggregate information about the percentage progress of the ad viewed, whether it was skipped, clicked or completed. They also contain meta information about the played ads.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.name: table_media_ads
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_media_ad.block_contents: This derived table aggregates information about ads. Each row represents one ad played within a certain media on a certain platform. Stats about the number of ad clicks, progress reached and more are calculated as total values but also as counts of unique users (identified using `user_identifier`).

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_ses.name: table_base_sessions_lifecycle_manifest
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_ses.block_contents:
This incremental table is a manifest of all sessions that have been processed by the Snowplow dbt media package. For each session, the start and end timestamp is recorded.

By knowing the lifecycle of a session the model is able to able to determine which sessions and thus events to process for a given timeframe, as well as the complete date range required to reprocess all events of each session.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_inc.name: table_base_incremental_manifest
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_inc.block_contents: This incremental table is a manifest of the timestamp of the latest event consumed per model within the Snowplow dbt media package as well as any models leveraging the incremental framework provided by the package. The latest event's timestamp is based off `collector_tstamp`. This table is used to determine what events should be processed in the next run of the model.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_new.name: table_base_new_event_limits
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_new.block_contents: This table contains the lower and upper timestamp limits for the given run of the web model. These limits are used to select new events from the events table.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_eve.name: table_base_events_this_run
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_eve.block_contents:
For any given run, this table contains all required events to be consumed by subsequent nodes in the Snowplow dbt media package. This is a cleaned, deduped dataset, containing all columns from the raw events table as well as having the `page_view_id` joined in from the page view context, and all of the fields parsed from the various media contexts.

**Note: This table should be used as the input to any custom modules that require event level data, rather than selecting straight from `atomic.events`**

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_ses.name: table_base_sessions_this_run
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_ses.block_contents: For any given run, this table contains all the required sessions.

doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_qua.name: table_base_quarantined_sessions
doc.snowplow_media_player.table_base_qua.block_contents:
This table contains any sessions that have been quarantined. Sessions are quarantined once they exceed the maximum allowed session length, defined by `snowplow__max_session_days`.
Once quarantined, no further events from these sessions will be processed. Events up until the point of quarantine remain in your derived tables.
The reason for removing long sessions is to reduce table scans on both the events table and all derived tables. This improves performance greatly.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_dtype_to.name: macro_dtype_to_type
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_dtype_to.block_contents:
This macro retrieves the database specific data type from the dtype property.

#### Returns

dbt `{{ type_...() }}` macro.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_field_al.name: macro_field_alias
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_field_al.block_contents:
This macro returns a field alias in snake case with the prefix if set.

#### Returns

Field alias.

#### Usage

```sql
field_alias(field={'field': 'sessionId', 'dtype': 'string'}, prefix='media_session_')
```
Returns `media_session__session_id`.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_get_cont.name: macro_get_context_fields
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_get_cont.block_contents:
This macro returns specified fields from a context column.

#### Returns

Fields from context column. If `enabled` is false, it casts the fields as nulls.

#### Usage

```sql
{{ get_context_fields(
      enabled=var('snowplow__enable_whatwg_video', false),
      context='contexts_org_whatwg_video_element_1',
      prefix='html5_video_element_',
      fields=[
        {'field':'videoWidth', 'dtype':'integer'},
        {'field':'videoHeight', 'dtype':'integer'},
      ]) }}
```

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_get_enab.name: macro_get_enabled_context_fields
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_get_enab.block_contents:
This macro is used in the `get_context_fields` macro and returns fields from a context column if enabled. For BigQuery, it uses the `snowplow_utils.get_optional_fields`, else the `snowplow_utils.get_fields` macro is used. For Postgres/Redshift nothing is returned as context fields are already extracted in the base macro.

#### Returns

Fields from context column.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_snakeify.name: macro_snakeify_case
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_snakeify.block_contents:
This macro takes a string in camel/pascal case and transforms it to snake case.

#### Returns

String in snake case.

#### Usage

```sql
{{ snakeify_case('mediaSessionId') }}
```
Returns `media_session_id`

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_allow_re.name: macro_allow_refresh
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_allow_re.block_contents:
This macro is used to determine if a full-refresh is allowed (depending on the environment), using the `snowplow__allow_refresh` variable.

#### Returns

`snowplow__allow_refresh` if environment is not `dev`, `none` otherwise.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_event_na.name: macro_event_name_filter
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_event_na.block_contents:
This macro is used to add a filter on `event_name` if provided.

#### Returns

Filter for `event_name` values inputted `event_names` list or `lower(event_vendor) = 'com.snowplowanalytics.snowplow.media'`

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_get_perc.name: macro_get_percentage_boundaries
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_get_perc.block_contents:
This macro gets the list of percentage boundaries which are set in the tracker.

#### Returns

Percentage boundaries, e.g. `[25,50,75,100]`

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_session_.name: macro_session_identifiers
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_session_.block_contents:
This macro is used to set the `session_identifier` used in the base macros.

#### Returns

`snowplow__session_identifiers` if set. Otherwise it defaults to the media session id if enabled, else the page/screen view id from web and mobile.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_user_ide.name: macro_user_identifiers
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_user_ide.block_contents:
This macro is used to set the `user_identifier` used in the base macros.

#### Returns

`snowplow__user_identifiers` if set. Otherwise it defaults to the domain_userid for web or user_id from the client session context for mobile.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_media_ev.name: macro_media_event_type_field
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_media_ev.block_contents:
Retrieves the event type either from the media player event in case of v1 media schemas or the event name in case of v2 media schemas.

#### Returns

The query for the event_type column.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_media_pl.name: macro_media_player_type_field
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_media_pl.block_contents:
This macro produces the value media_player_type column in the snowplow_media_player_base_events_this_run table based on the values of the youtube_player_id and media_player_id columns.

#### Returns

The query for the media_player_type column.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_media_ty.name: macro_media_type_field
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_media_ty.block_contents:
This macro produces the value media_type column in the snowplow_media_player_base_events_this_run table based on the column for media_type in the media context or returns video for youtube.

#### Returns

The query for the media_type column.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_percent_.name: macro_percent_progress_field
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_percent_.block_contents:
This macro produces the value for the percentage progress in case of percent progress events.
For v1 media schemas, the value is taken from the media player context entity.
For v2 media schemas, it is calculated based on the current time, duration and defined percentage boundaries.

#### Returns

The query for the percent_progress field.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_playback.name: macro_playback_quality_field
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_playback.block_contents:
This macro produces the value for the playback_quality column in the snowplow_media_player_base_events_this_run table based on the values of the quality in youtube context or video_width and video_height columns in media context.

#### Returns

The query for the playback_quality column.

doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_config_c.name: macro_config_check
doc.snowplow_media_player.macro_config_c.block_contents: A macro that checks if at least one of the platform enabling variables is true and if the media player contexts variable configuration is valid before the run starts. Raises and error to alert users in the case the variable configuration is not valid.

doc.snowplow_media_player.__snowplow_med.name: __snowplow_media_player__
doc.snowplow_media_player.__snowplow_med.block_contents:
# Snowplow Media Player Package

Welcome to the documentation site for the Snowplow Media Player dbt package. The package transforms raw media player event data into derived tables for easier querying generated by the Snowplow [JavaScript tracker][javascript-tracker] in combination with media tracking specific plugins such as the [Media Tracking plugin][media-tracking] or the [YouTube Tracking plugin][youtube-tracking]. The package also supports media events generated by the Snowplow [iOS and Android trackers][mobile-media-tracker-docs].

**For more information, including a QuickStart guide, operation and configuration, and implementing your own custom modules on top of this please visit the [Snowplow Docs](https://docs.snowplow.io/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/) for more detailed information.**

*Note this model design doc site is linked to latest release of the package. If you are not using the latest release, [generate and serve](https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/commands/cmd-docs#dbt-docs-serve) the doc site locally for accurate documentation.*

## Overview

This package consists of a series of incremental dbt models with the goal to produce the following main aggregated models from the raw media player events and relevant contexts:

| Model                                    | Description                                                                                                      |
|------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| snowplow_media_player_base               | A table summarizing media player events by media and pageview including impressions.                             |
| snowplow_media_player_plays_by_pageview  | A view summarizing media plays by media on a pageview level.                                                     |
| snowplow_media_player_media_stats        | An aggregated table of media metrics on a media_identifier level.                                                        |
| snowplow_media_player_media_ad_views     | A view summarizing each ad viewed within a media playback (only for v2 schemas, see above).                      |
| snowplow_media_player_media_ads          | An aggregated table of ad metrics for each ad played within each media content (only for v2 schemas, see above). |

## Installation

Check [dbt Hub](https://hub.getdbt.com/snowplow/snowplow_media_player/latest/) for the latest installation instructions, or read the [dbt docs][dbt-package-docs] for more information on installing packages. If you already have the web package installed you might need to upgrade it in order for it to be compatible with the media_player package requirements. Otherwise it is enough to install the media_player package as it will add the web package automatically due to the dependencies.

# Join the Snowplow community

We welcome all ideas, questions and contributions!

For support requests, please use our community support [Discourse][discourse] forum.

If you find a bug, please report an issue on GitHub.

# Copyright and license

model.snowplow_media_player_integration_.name: snowplow_media_player_events_stg
model.snowplow_media_player_integration_.raw_code:
{#
Copyright (c) 2022-present Snowplow Analytics Ltd. All rights reserved.
This program is licensed to you under the Snowplow Personal and Academic License Version 1.0,
and you may not use this file except in compliance with the Snowplow Personal and Academic License Version 1.0.
You may obtain a copy of the Snowplow Personal and Academic License Version 1.0 at https://docs.snowplow.io/personal-and-academic-license-1.0/
#}

{{
  config(
    materialized='table',
  )
}}

with prep as (
  select
    * except(
      contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_web_page_1_0_0,
      contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_mobile_screen_1_0_0,
      contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_client_session_1_0_2,
      contexts_org_whatwg_video_element_1_0_0,
      contexts_org_whatwg_media_element_1_0_0,
      contexts_com_youtube_youtube_1_0_0,
      contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_1_0_0,
      contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_2_0_0,
      contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_session_1_0_0,
      contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_1_0_0,
      contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_break_1_0_0,
      unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_event_1_0_0,
      unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_quartile_event_1_0_0,
      sf_contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_client_session_1_0_2,
      sf_contexts_org_whatwg_video_element_1_0_0,
      sf_contexts_org_whatwg_media_element_1_0_0,
      sf_contexts_com_youtube_youtube_1_0_0,
      sf_contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_1_0_0,
      sf_contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_2_0_0,
      sf_contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_session_1_0_0,
      sf_contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_1_0_0,
      sf_contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_break_1_0_0,
      sf_unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_quartile_event_1_0_0
    ),
    from_json(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_web_page_1_0_0, 'array<struct<id:string>>') as contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_web_page_1,
    from_json(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_mobile_screen_1_0_0, 'array<struct<name:string, type:string, id:string, view_controller:string, top_view_controller:string, activity:string, fragment:string>>') as contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_mobile_screen_1,
    from_json(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_client_session_1_0_2, 'array<struct<user_id:string, session_id:string, session_index:integer, event_index:integer, previous_session_id:string, storage_mechanism:string, first_event_id:string, first_event_timestamp:string>>') as contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_client_session_1,
    from_json(contexts_org_whatwg_video_element_1_0_0, 'array<struct<video_height:integer, video_width:integer, auto_picture_in_picture:boolean, disable_picture_in_picture:boolean, poster:string >>') as contexts_org_whatwg_video_element_1,
    from_json(contexts_org_whatwg_media_element_1_0_0, 'array<struct<auto_play:boolean, current_src:string, default_muted:boolean, default_playback_rate:double ,html_id:string,media_type:string,network_state:string,preload:string,ready_state:string,seeking:boolean,cross_origin:string,disable_remote_playback:boolean,error:string,file_extension:string,fullscreen:boolean,picture_in_picture:boolean,src:string>>') as contexts_org_whatwg_media_element_1,
    from_json(contexts_com_youtube_youtube_1_0_0, 'array<struct<auto_play:boolean, buffering:boolean, controls:boolean, cued:boolean, loaded:integer, playback_quality:string, player_id:string, unstarted:boolean, url:string, error:string, fov:double, origin:string, pitch:double, playlist_index:double, roll:double, yaw:double>>') as contexts_com_youtube_youtube_1,
    from_json(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_1_0_0, 'array<struct<current_time:double, ended:boolean, loop:boolean, muted:boolean, paused:boolean, playback_rate:double, volume:integer, duration:double, is_live:boolean, percent_progress:integer>>') as contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_1,
    from_json(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_2_0_0, 'array<struct<current_time:double, duration:double, ended: boolean, fullscreen:boolean, livestream:boolean, label:string, loop:boolean, media_type:string, muted:boolean, paused:boolean, picture_in_picture:boolean, playback_rate:double, player_type:string, quality:string, volume:integer>>') as contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_2,
    from_json(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_session_1_0_0, 'array<struct<media_session_id:string, started_at:string, ping_interval:integer, time_played:double, time_played_muted:double, time_paused:double, content_watched:double, time_buffering:double, time_spent_ads:double, ads:integer, ads_clicked:integer, ads_skipped:integer, ad_breaks:integer, avg_playback_rate:double>>') as contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_session_1,
    from_json(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_1_0_0, 'array<struct<name:string, ad_id:string, creative_id:string, pod_position:integer, duration:double, skippable:boolean>>') as contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_1,
    from_json(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_break_1_0_0, 'array<struct<name:string, break_id:string, start_time:string, break_type:string, pod_size:integer>>') as contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_break_1,
    from_json(unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_event_1_0_0, 'struct<type:string, label:string>') as unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_event_1,
    from_json(unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_quartile_event_1_0_0, 'struct<percent_progress:integer>') as unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_quartile_event_1

  from {{ ref('snowplow_media_player_events') }}

)

  select
    *

  from prep

    JSON_EXTRACT_ARRAY(contexts_org_whatwg_media_element_1_0_0) AS contexts_org_whatwg_media_element_1_0_0,
    JSON_EXTRACT_ARRAY(contexts_com_youtube_youtube_1_0_0) AS contexts_com_youtube_youtube_1_0_0,
    JSON_EXTRACT_ARRAY(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_1_0_0) AS contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_1_0_0,
    JSON_EXTRACT_ARRAY(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_2_0_0) AS contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_2_0_0,
    JSON_EXTRACT_ARRAY(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_session_1_0_0) AS contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_session_1_0_0,
    JSON_EXTRACT_ARRAY(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_1_0_0) AS contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_1_0_0,
    JSON_EXTRACT_ARRAY(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_break_1_0_0) AS contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_break_1_0_0,
    PARSE_JSON(unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_event_1_0_0) AS unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_event_1_0_0,
    PARSE_JSON(unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_quartile_event_1_0_0) AS unstruct_event_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_ad_quartile_event_1_0_0

  from {{ ref('snowplow_media_player_events') }}
)

select
  * except(
    contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_web_page_1_0_0,

    contexts_org_whatwg_video_element_1_0_0,
    contexts_org_whatwg_media_element_1_0_0,
    contexts_com_youtube_youtube_1_0_0,

    contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_media_player_2_0_0,

-- test dataset includes page_view_id as part of events table.
-- RS and PG events tables are federated so split out page_view_id into its own table

with prep as (
select
  event_id as root_id,
  collector_tstamp as root_tstamp,
  split_part(split_part(contexts_com_snowplowanalytics_snowplow_web_page_1_0_0,'[{"id":"', 2), '"}]', 1) as id -- test dataset uses json format. Extract.

from {{ ref('snowplow_media_player_events') }}

)

select
  root_id,
  root_tstamp,
  case when id = 'null' or id = '' then null else id end as id

from prep
